alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 21 at 4:27PM AKST until December 22 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following area, Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. - Mudslides and debris flows are possible along steep hillsides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM AKST, Reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain across the warned area. Flooding is ongoing. Between 6 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2.5 to 3.5 inches are possible. Local emergency management has recommended driving only if necessary - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Aleutians zone - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Stay away from steep barren hillsides due to the landslide danger.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
